episodeTitle: Fiery Kicks! Sanji's Full Course of Foot Techniques!
episodeTitleJapanese: 灼熱の蹴り！サンジ足技のフルコース
episodeTitleRomanized: Shakunetsu no Keri! Sanji Ashiwaza no Fullcourse
description: Sanji battles Jabra of CP9 in the Tower of Justice. Despite being at a disadvantage against Jabra's Tekkai Kenpo, Sanji unveils his revolutionary new technique, Diable Jambe, setting his leg ablaze to break through Jabra's iron defense and claim victory.

events.title: Sanji vs Jabra Intensifies
events.description: The battle between Sanji and Jabra continues in the Tower of Justice. Jabra uses his Tekkai Kenpo techniques to defend against Sanji's powerful kicks, appearing to gain the upper hand.
events.significance: Sets up the climactic confrontation that will showcase Sanji's new power and demonstrates the strength of CP9's third-strongest member.

events.title: Jabra's Deceptive Story
events.description: Jabra attempts to deceive Sanji by claiming that Nico Robin is his long-lost sister and tells an elaborate fabricated story about their shared past in the West Blue. He offers to give Sanji his key and appears to surrender.
events.significance: Demonstrates Jabra's cunning nature and willingness to use deception in battle, but also highlights Sanji's perceptiveness in seeing through lies.

quotes.speaker: Jabra
quotes.context: Jabra's attempt to deceive Sanji with a fabricated story

events.title: Sanji Sees Through the Deception
events.description: Sanji quickly realizes that Jabra's story is completely fabricated. Before Jabra can launch his surprise attack, Sanji declares he will kick him twice as hard for trying to deceive him.
events.significance: Shows Sanji's intelligence and intuition, refusing to fall for obvious deception even when it involves a woman.

quotes.text: I'll kick you twice as hard for that lie!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's response after seeing through Jabra's deception

events.title: Sanji Attempts Deuxième Hachis
events.description: Sanji launches a barrage of kicks at Jabra using his Deuxième Hachis technique, but is unable to pierce through Jabra's powerful Tekkai iron body defense. Jabra gets back up, acknowledging Sanji as a worthy opponent.
events.significance: Demonstrates the limits of Sanji's regular techniques against high-level Rokushiki users, setting up the need for his new power.

events.title: Diable Jambe Debut
events.description: Sanji reveals his revolutionary new technique, Diable Jambe. By spinning at high speed, he generates enough friction to set his right leg ablaze with intense flames. This enhancement allows his kicks to pierce through even the strongest Tekkai defenses.
events.significance: Marks a major power-up for Sanji and introduces one of his signature techniques that will be used throughout the series. This is his answer to the power levels of CP9 and beyond.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji unveiling his new fire-based technique for the first time

events.title: Diable Jambe: Premier Hachis
events.description: Sanji performs a running jump and delivers rapid dual-leg kicks enhanced by Diable Jambe's flames, targeting Jabra's stomach with devastating force and breaking through his Tekkai defense.
events.significance: First application of Diable Jambe in combat, demonstrating its effectiveness against powerful defensive techniques.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's first named Diable Jambe attack

events.title: Jabra's Moonlight Ten Finger Pistol
events.description: Jabra counters with his powerful Gekko Jusshigan (Moonlight Ten Finger Pistol), combining Geppo and Shigan to launch a piercing aerial attack that successfully hits Sanji.
events.significance: Shows that despite Sanji's new power, Jabra remains a formidable opponent capable of landing significant blows.

events.title: Diable Jambe: Flambage Shot Defeats Jabra
events.description: Despite taking Jabra's attack, Sanji delivers the finishing blow with Diable Jambe: Flambage Shot, a devastating flaming side kick that hits Jabra squarely in the face. The attack sends Jabra crashing to the ground, defeated. Jabra realizes his ribs are broken and he's been burned to the bone.
events.significance: Sanji's victory over the third-strongest CP9 member proves his growth and cements Diable Jambe as a game-changing technique. This is a pivotal moment in the Enies Lobby rescue mission.

events.title: Sanji Claims Jabra's Key
events.description: With Jabra defeated, Sanji obtains his key, bringing the Straw Hat Pirates one step closer to rescuing Robin from the World Government.
events.significance: Marks the completion of one of the critical CP9 battles needed to save Robin, advancing the Enies Lobby Arc's central mission.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji unveiling his new fire-based technique

quotes.text: I'll kick you twice as hard for that lie!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's response after seeing through Jabra's deception

themes.description: Episode 298 showcases Sanji's evolution as a fighter, unveiling Diable Jambe as a response to the increasing strength of their enemies. This represents his determination to protect his crew and rescue Robin.
themes.symbolism: The flames of Diable Jambe symbolize Sanji's burning passion and determination, literally manifesting his hot-blooded nature into combat power.

themes.description: Jabra's attempt to deceive Sanji with a fabricated story about Robin tests Sanji's judgment and perceptiveness, showing that even in battle, mental fortitude is as important as physical strength.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between Jabra's lies and Sanji's straightforward fighting style highlights the themes of honor and integrity in combat.

themes.description: Sanji endures Jabra's powerful attacks but refuses to give up, demonstrating the crew's unwavering commitment to rescuing Robin no matter the cost.
themes.symbolism: Sanji taking damage but still delivering the finishing blow represents the Straw Hats' willingness to sacrifice for their nakama.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji unveils his revolutionary Diable Jambe technique, marking a significant power-up. This episode demonstrates his growth since entering the Grand Line and his determination to save Robin.
keyActions: Reveals Diable Jambe for the first time
Defeats Jabra with Diable Jambe: Flambage Shot
Obtains Jabra's key for Robin's rescue

characterSpotlights.development: Jabra demonstrates his cunning with attempted deception and his power with Tekkai Kenpo, but ultimately falls to Sanji's new technique. His defeat shows the growing strength of the Straw Hat Pirates.
keyActions: Attempts to deceive Sanji with fabricated story
Uses Tekkai Kenpo to defend against Sanji's attacks
Defeated by Diable Jambe: Flambage Shot

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the battle sequences with additional animation of the fight choreography not present in the manga panels.
Jabra's deceptive story about being Robin's sibling included cartoon-style animation in the anime to emphasize the absurdity of the lie.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode where Sanji uses his Diable Jambe technique, which becomes one of his signature moves throughout the rest of the series.
The episode adapts manga chapters 414-416, with Chapter 415 titled 'Heat Up' specifically focusing on the Diable Jambe reveal.
Jabra's Doriki power level was measured at 2180, making him the third-strongest member of CP9, yet he was defeated by Sanji who had no official power rating.
The eye catches in this episode featured Sanji and Usopp in swapped positions, a detail noted by fans.
Episode 298 aired on February 25, 2007 in Japan and received an IMDB rating of 8.6, indicating strong fan reception.
